titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Union of Beaver County records 1905-1911
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Union of Beaver County records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Union of Beaver County was formed in 1905 to advance the kingdom of God in Beaver County, to deepen the spiritual life of the Union's members, and to bring the churches represented into closer fellowship and sympathy. Its members were pastors and elders of the Presbyterian churches in Beaver County, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes recording routine business conducted at meetings of the Presbyterian Union of Beaver County, 1905-1911. Minutes record titles of papers read and include the Union's constitution and a list of members.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
